column4: Alright, I've been fighting with it for about an hour. Not making any ground. Running an HP laptop, wireless hardware switch disabled. How do I enable?
run this to identify the card then let us know what it is   lspci | grep -i wireless
Ethernet controller: Atheros Communications Inc. AR 5001 Wireless Network (rev 01)
I have the same card, it has always worked, any more details you can share?
Just installed 11.04 from disc onto the laptop, started out disabled.
have you plugged in the ethernet cord and done a update/upgrade
is there a switch that may be off?
Yes, I did infact. Rebooted as the manger said, turned it back on and the "switch" still doesn't work. It's just a button beside the power button.
It's lit up blue like in windows when it's on, but network settings still says it's disabled by hardware switch .
look in additional drivers to see if any are available.
Unfortunately, no. I've already looked there.
run this in the terminal sudo rfkill unblock all
Supposed to get some kind of message? Just goes back to command line.
try the swithch now
No change :/
thats about the extent of my knowledge in that area, sorry.
Odd. I did rfkill list - saw the block, tried the unblock all again, worked.
I'm giddy as a little girl. ;-)
Not sure why it didn't unblock in the first place, I just trolled back up previous entered commands in terminal and hit it again? *shrug*
lol
Appreciate the help.
no problem, gogoled it and got lucky.
